bib_record.title: Transfer of Li-6 Break-Up Fragments at Li-6 Projectile Energies Far Above the Coulomb Barrier

0.free_text: The Cross Sections are Strongly Connected to theBreak-Up of the Li-6 Projectile Followed by CaptureOf the Beam-Veclocity Alpha-Particle - "InternalBreak-Up Reaction".  At 156 MeV the Internal Break-UpContribution was Experimentally Separated from ThatPart of the Cross Section Due to Compound/PrecompoundReactions. This Part is Less Than 10%For Lower Energies It was Assumed That this PartPlays a Minor Role, Too.

The Cross Sections are Strongly Connected to theBreak-Up of the Li-6 Projectile Followed by CaptureOf the Beam-Veclocity Alpha-Particle - "InternalBreak-Up Reaction".  At 156 MeV the Internal Break-UpContribution was Experimentally Separated from ThatPart of the Cross Section Due to Compound/PrecompoundReactions. This Part is Less Than 10%.For Lower Energies It was Assumed That this PartPlays a Minor Role, Too.

The Cross Sections are Strongly Connected to theBreak-Up of the Li-6 Projectile Followed by CaptureOf the Beam-Veclocity Alpha-Particle - "InternalBreak-Up Reaction".  At 156 MeV the Internal Break-UpContribution was Experimentally Separated from ThatPart of the Cross Section Due to Compound/PrecompoundReactions. This Part is Less Than 10%.

free_txt: The Main Goal of the Work was the Investigation of
Different Reaction Mechanisms by Determining the Recoil
Energies. This was Achieved by Measuring the Range
Of Recoils in Carbon Catcher Foils. Additionally the
Recoil Energies were Determined by Measuring the
Energy Loss of the Alpha-Particles Emitted by the
Decaying Residues Due to Self-Absorption in the
Catcher Foil.
Two Si Surface Barrier Detectors were Mounted
In a Sandwich Arrangement with a Total Acceptance of
25% of 4 Pi.
The Errors of the Cross Sections Result
Mainly from the Statistical Uncertainties in the
Activity Measurements(15%), the Target Thickness (5%)
And the Beam Flux Determination (10%).  Additionally,
The Errors were Taken Into Consideration Attributed to
A Correction of the Cross Sections For the Recoil
Catching Efficiency and Activity Build-Up from Cycles
Before.  The Informations About the Errors were
Obtained Essentially by the Author.
High Spin Isomer (J=25/2+). The Isomer is not Product
Of at-211 and Rn-215 Radioactive Decay.
This Value was Erroneously Quoted As 85 Mb
Instead of 85 Microbarn in the Publication.
The Initial Projectile Energy of 156 MeV was Stepwise
Degraded by be-Sheets. The Energy Loss of Li-6 was
Calculated Using Extrapolations of the Energy Loss
Relation of L.C.Northcliffe and R.F.Schilling, Nucl.
Data Tables A7 (1970).
The Recoils have Been Catched in Carbon Foils of
Various Thicknesses. The Catcher Foils were Mounted on
A Pneumatic Driven Slider Transporting the Activity
Out of the Beam to the Measuring Position.
Each Measuring Cycle Consisted of
The Irradiating Period, the Recording Period and the
Transport Period, Forth and Back.
The Beam Current was 15 Nanoampere, Typically.
In Addition to the Decay Energy the Alpha-Peaks were
Identified in a Separate Run Via the Half-Life by
Measuring in a Multispectrum Scaling Procedure.
Pb-208, Thickness 0.15 Mg/Cm**2, Evaporated onto
20 Micro G/Cm**2 C-Foil. The Thickness was Determined
By Measuring the Energy Loss of Am-241 Alpha-Particles.
The Numerical Values of the Data were Obtained by
The Author.
High Spin Isomer (J=25/2+). The Isomer is not Product
Of at-211 and Rn-215 Radioactive Decay.

Degraded by be-Sheets. The Energy Loss of Li-6 was

Bi-209,Thickness 0.36 Mg/Cm**2, Evaporated onto
10 Micrometer Al-Foil.
The Numerical Values of the Data were Obtained by
The Author.
